column3: Description
The date the entity's data was last updated.
Internal Net Zero Tracker identification code.
An ISIN (International Securities Identification Number) is a 12-character alphanumeric code that uniquely identifies publicly listed companies.
The official name of the entity.
The country the entity is located, in ISO-3 (ISO 3166-1). For companies, this refers to the country of their headquarters.
The geographic region the entity is in or headquartered in. [Africa, East Asia, Europe, Latin America and the Caribbean, North America, Oceania, South Asia, Western and Central Asia]
The type of entity making the commitment. [Country, region, city, or company]
Whether the entity is a private company (as opposed to a publicly listed company). [Yes/No]
How the entity describes its end net zero or mitigation target.
The percentage reduction in emissions aimed for by the end target year.
The reference year against which end target emission reductions are measured.
The year the end net zero or mitigation targets is to be achieved.
The current status of the end target. [Achieved (externally validated); Achieved (self-declared); In law; In policy document; In corporate strategy; Declaration / pledge; Proposed / in discussion]
Year when the current target status was reached.
A textual description of the end net zero or mitigation target.
A website link to the official source of the end net zero or mitigation target.
A near-term emissions reduction target set before the end target year.
The year the interim target is to be achieved.
The percentage reduction in emissions aimed for by the interim target year.
The reference year against which interim target emission reductions are measured.
A textual description of the interim target(s).
Additional details of interim and end targets, including archived links to sources.
The greenhouse gases covered by the target [CO₂ only, CO₂ and other GHGs, Not specified]
Whether the entity covers emissions from owned or controlled sources. [Yes / No / Not specified]
Whether the entity covers emissions from purchased electricity, steam, heating, and cooling. [Yes / No / Not specified]
Whether the entity covers all other emissions in the value chain, including upstream and downstream activities. [Yes / No / Not specified]
Additional details about the scope of emissions coverage.
Whether the entity has a published plan to meet its end net zero or mitigation target [Yes / No]

Details of the published plan, asking whether the entity has specified: (i) Measures or steps that will be taken for all emission scopes that are covered by the target (ii) Information on the emission reductions expected from these measures within a certain time period (iii) Information on the extent to which measures/steps will be taken (e.g. if switching to electric vehicles) (iv) A schedule for regular reviews of measures.
Whether there is a reporting on progress toward net-zero goals. [No reporting mechanism, Less frequently than annually, Annual reporting]

Considerations of 'fair share' responsibility for mitigation or just transition principles. May refer to: - Equity between countries, for example a statement about how the entity’s targets contributes to their fair share of the global carbon budget. - Equity across different groups in society (e.g. a reference to the rights of communities, or a just transition for workers in fossil fuel intensive sectors).
Whether any of the leadership of the entity is formally accountable for delivery on the target.
Additional details about the governance aspects of the end net zero or mitigation target.
Does the target allow for traded carbon credits (offsets) from outside the entities’ territory / value chain to meet the target? [Yes, No, Not specified]

Whether the entity specifies conditions on the trading of carbon credits (offsets)? Categories: - No conditions specified - Must be high environmental integrity - Avoid social harm - Avoid biodiversity harm - Not include avoided emissions (e.g. via renewable energy projects) - Not include emissions reductions (e.g. via greater efficiency) - Not include biological sequestration (e.g. via afforestation) - Maximum % of emissions that can be offset - Other conditions
If 'Maximum % of emissions that can be offset' specified, the percentage value (0-100).
Details of other carbon credit conditions.
Whether the entity has separate targets for emission reductions and removals. [Yes / No]

Whether the entity uses or plans to use carbon dioxide removal (CDR) within its target boundary (i.e. not external offsets)? - No - Yes (unspecified) - Yes (nature-based removals e.g. Forestation, soil carbon enhancement) - Yes (CCS-based removals e.g. BECCS, DACCS) - Yes (nature-based and CCS-based removals) - Not specified
Additional details about the use of carbon credits or removals in the end net zero or mitigation target.

Whether the end target covers all 'territorial emissions'. Sometimes called production emissions, territorial emissions are those generated within a city or state’s boundaries. [Yes, No, Not specified]
Whether the end target covers 'consumption emissions'. This include 'embodied emissions' in goods that are imported from outside the country, city or state’s boundaries. [Yes, No, Not specified]
Whether the end target covers international shipping i.e. ships coming to / leaving the country. [Yes, No, Not specified]
Whether the end target covers international aviation i.e. flights coming to / leaving the country. [Yes, No, Not specified]
Whether the end target scope includes a goal to neutralise all historical emissions ever emitted by the entity.
Whether the entity is a member of the Race to Zero campain [Yes / No]
The entity's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) in Purchasing Power Parity (PPP) — 2021 USD for countries; 2017 USD for regions and cities (where available).
The corresponding year of the GDP variable.
The population of the entity (for countries, regions, or cities).
The corresponding year of the Population variable.
The total revenue generated by the entity in the most recent recorded year.

The broad industry classification of the entity [Apparel; Biotech, Health Care & Pharma; Food, Beverage & Agriculture; Fossil Fuels; Hospitality; Infrastructure; Manufacturing; Materials; Power Generation; Retail; Services; Transportation Services]
The number of employees working for the company.
The total greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions of the entity in GHG equivalent. For countries, this *includes* emissions from land use, land use change and forestry (LULUCF).
The corresponding year of the GHG emissions variable.
The source of the GHG emissions figure e.g. World Bank, Climate Watch,  EDGAR
The unit used to express the emissions intensity of the end target (e.g. tCO₂e per GDP).
The emissions level in the baseline year for the end target.
The expected emissions level in the target year.
The projected emissions level in the target year under a business-as-usual scenario.
Description of other end target.
The unit used to express emissions intensity for the interim target.
The emissions level in the baseline year for the interim target.
The expected emissions level in the interim target year.
The projected emissions level in the interim target year under a business-as-usual scenario.
Description of other interim target.
